intro: Cynanchum thruppii, commonly known as the Chinese milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in summer. Its roots are somewhat fibrous and have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Cynanchum thruppii is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
